title: Ticket #7664: condor_drain should be clear that it is draining one startd
description: LIGO was surprised that condor_drain quietly drains a single startd, not the whole machine. Let's make this really clear in the output of condor_drain
remarks:
2020-Jun-16 14:42:41 by coatsworth:
This is done now. One additional thing I found confusing is that condor_drain only targets a single slot, but drains the entire startd. So I also updated the output with the startd address to make this more clear. The output message now looks like this:

Sent request to drain the startd <127.0.0.1:33816?addrs=127.0.0.1-33816&alias=goatpriest&noUDP&sock=startd_12563_10cc> with slot1@goatpriest. This only affects the single startd; any other startds running on the same host will not be drained.

Apparently Miron wanted it to work this way, so hopefully the expansion of output message makes it more clear.
